intro: Pseudognaphalium sandwicensium, commonly known as the Hawaiian daisy, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has silver-gray foliage with small, white to pale yellow flowers. It is adapted to the dry, sunny conditions of its native habitat. Pseudognaphalium sandwicensium is also known for its aromatic properties and is sometimes used in traditional Hawaiian medicine.
